items.title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Why brokerages are positive on Ambuja Cement and Century Plyboards but cautious on Kajaria
items.description: Brokerages maintain a selectively constructive stance on building material stocks, highlighting company-specific catalysts, restructuring benefits, and margin expansion potential despite near-term risks. HDFC Securities remains cautious on Kajaria Ceramics, while Antique and Nuvama are bullish on Ambuja Cement and Century Plyboards, citing structural simplification, cost savings, volume growth, and improving profitability.

items.title: Dhurandhar has packed the theatres. Is Avatar the next catalyst to lift PVR Inox shares out of a long slump?
items.description: PVR Inox shares are showing signs of life with the success of Dhurandhar and the release of Avatar: Fire and Ash. These films are expected to boost box office collections in the current quarter. Analysts believe this content surge could lead to modest earnings upgrades for the company.

items.title: Jupiter Wagons, MCX India and 4 other stocks flash bullish signals, indicating a possible uptrend
items.description: On December 22, in the Nifty 500 pack, six stocks that gained over 5% appeared on the bullish “White Marubozu” scanner, according to StockEdge.com’s technical scan data. A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis. It occurs when the opening price is the lowest and the closing price is the highest for a given period.Represented by a long white (or green) candlestick with no upper shadow and a small or nonexistent lower shadow, it indicates strong buying pressure throughout the session. Traders interpret it as a signal that buyers were in control from the opening to the closing, often using such patterns for informed decisions about future price movements in financial markets.

items.title: RVNL, IRCTC, Jupiter Wagons shares jump up to 8% as railway stocks extend rally, all eyes now on Budget 2026
items.description: Railway stocks extended their rebound on Tuesday, with Jupiter Wagons, IRCTC and RailTel gaining as investors reposition ahead of Union Budget 2026. The rally builds on stock-specific triggers and renewed capex hopes, even as the sector remains scarred by steep losses through much of 2025.

items.title: Explained: What merger of Ambuja Cements, ACC, Orient Cement means for Adani shareholders
items.description: Ambuja Cements’ board approved merger schemes to combine ACC and Orient Cement into Ambuja through share swaps, with no cash payout. ACC shareholders will get 328 Ambuja shares for every 100 ACC shares, while Orient shareholders receive 33 Ambuja shares per 100 Orient shares. The swap values ACC near its current market price and offers Orient a roughly 9% premium.

items.title: Four lost years push Indian IT to an AI reckoning. Will TCS, Infosys, Wipro deliver in 2026?
items.description: Indian IT stocks, after a four-year slump, face an AI reckoning. While past growth was fueled by pandemic spending, a cautious global market and AI's initial efficiency gains have pressured revenues. Experts anticipate a gradual AI-driven recovery, with 2026 expected to bring stability and renewed confidence as companies integrate AI into core business processes.

items.title: KSH International shares list at 4% discount to IPO price on BSE, NSE
items.description: KSH International listed at a nearly 4% discount to its IPO price, reflecting muted investor sentiment after the issue saw just 83% subscription. The company cut its OFS size post-issue to support smoother allotment. Despite strong fundamentals, valuation concerns dominated demand across non-institutional and retail categories.

items.title: GPT Infraprojects shares zoom 6% after being declared L1 bidder for Rs 670 crore NHAI project
items.description: GPT Infraprojects shares: The company emerged as the L1 bidder for a Rs 670 crore NHAI infrastructure project. The order was secured through a consortium with ISCPPL and disclosed in a regulatory filing.

items.title: Auto stocks rally up to 140% in 2025. How smooth will the road be in 2026?
items.description: India's auto sector is experiencing a robust rally, driven by a significant GST rate reduction in September. This policy shift has spurred broad-based demand across passenger vehicles, two-wheelers, tractors, and commercial vehicles. Auto ancillaries are outperforming, fueled by strong exports and EV component growth, setting a positive outlook for 2026.

items.title: Sensex slips over 100 pts, Nifty below 26,200 as foreign outflows halt 2-day rally
items.description: Indian equities opened lower on Tuesday, breaking a two-day rally as foreign investors resumed selling. The Sensex and Nifty saw slight declines, with analysts anticipating thin trading volumes as the year concludes. The market awaits fresh catalysts ahead of the year-end.

items.title: SBI, Varun Beverages among Axis Securities’ top 9 stock picks for 2026, up to 23% upside seen
items.description: Axis Securities expects Indian equities to enter a robust earnings-led growth phase in 2026, forecasting the Nifty 50 to reach 28,100 by December 2026. This projection is based on a broad revival in corporate earnings, strong domestic macro fundamentals, a favorable policy backdrop, and a shift in global investor preference toward relatively insulated, consumption-driven economies like India.The brokerage believes that sectors aligned with credit growth, consumption, healthcare, and select cyclicals will be key beneficiaries in this phase. Against this backdrop, here are Axis Securities' top 9 stock picks, each offering an upside potential of up to 23%, based on fundamental strength and earnings visibility.

items.title: HNI demand didn’t save them: 12 heavily subscribed IPOs of 2025 are still underwater
items.description: India's IPO market is facing a harsh reality check as nearly half of the 102 listings in 2025 are trading below their issue price. Even strong demand from High Net Worth Individuals (HNIs) failed to protect 12 heavily subscribed IPOs, which are now underwater, highlighting issues beyond subscription frenzy.

items.title: Ola Electric shares in focus after clarification on promoter stake sale for debt repayment
items.description: Ola Electric shares: The company clarified that promoter Bhavish Aggarwal’s Rs 324 crore stake sale was a one-time move to repay debt. The proceeds were used to fully repay a Rs 260 crore promoter-level loan, including interest, and to release all pledged promoter shares.

items.title: Reliance Power among 4 Nifty500 stocks closing below VWAP
items.description: On December 22, the closing prices of four stocks from the Nifty 500 pack fell more than 1.5% below the VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price). A move below the VWAP suggests a potential bearish trend, according to StockEdge.com’s technical scan data.When the closing price falls below the VWAP, it signifies that the closing price is lower than the average price at which it was traded throughout the day, with the average being weighted by trading volume. This can be seen as a potential indication of increased selling pressure.

items.title: Ram Ratna Wires shares approach ex-date for 1:1 bonus issue. Do you own?
items.description: December 23 is the last day to buy Ram Ratna Wires shares to qualify for its 1:1 bonus issue. The record date is December 26, and with December 25 being a market holiday, the stock will turn ex-bonus on December 24. Investors must purchase shares by the close on December 23 to be eligible.

items.title: Ambuja Cements, Orient Cement shares zoom up to 10% following board approval for merger with Orient Cement
items.description: Ambuja Cements is embarking on an exciting merger with ACC Ltd and Orient Cement Ltd, a move designed to create a robust and unified cement platform across the Indian landscape. By merging, the companies aim to boost efficiency and refine their corporate framework.
